Hello, my name is Randy Kim.  I am currently the new Immigrant Organizer for the Korean-American Resource and Cultural Center in Chicago (KRCC).  I started this position a few days ago, and I'm looking to do a lot of networking with the Asian-American communities in Chicago, or even at the national level.  Visit our FB page or our website at www.chicagokrcc.org.  Thank you very much!
Hi Randy Kim! We're so glad that you've joined us! Please also join our meetup group, which is where we publicize our events and where the majority of our RSVP and sign-ups occur.
http://www.meetup.com/AsianAmericanChicagoNetwork/
Thank you so much...Are you guys based in Chicago?
Yes, we're in Chicago!

Well, I'm definitely interested in connnecting with your group.  I sent a friend request to you.  I know that we're always looking to reach out to not just the Korean, but the Asian-American community in Chicago.
I've accepted your friend request. We should definitely do some events together!

Join AAN on Saturday, August 11, for the 57th Annual Ginza Festival, one of the largest (and authentic) Japanese Festival in Chicago is being held in historic Old Town neighborhood. 

Join the AACN meetup group, where we manage our event signups, and RSVP  for the event: http://www.meetup.com/AsianAmericanChicagoNetwork/events/75198642/. (Please follow the instructions to register for an account.)
Our website is up!
Love it! Congrats on all the hard work! :)
Hello, new members! Please join us on our meetup page as well, where we post new events and where our RSVPs and sign-ups occur:

Join AACN, TAP-Chicago, KACC, NU-A5, and TAF, and 100+ new and old friends for an epic Asian American happy hour at Pump Room, one of Chicago's best bars and newest hotspots that was claimed "Dazzling" by Chicago Magazine, "Perfection" by Michigan Avenue Magazine, and "WOW" by the Chicago Tribute.

Guests will enjoy appetizers, courtesy of the Pump Room, and the venue's beautiful and modern ambiance. Dress to impress! Donations from the event will help fund scholarships for junior high and high school students to attend the TAF leadership development summer conference.

Thanks to Merry Richards Jewelers' generous sponsorship, free advance tickets to the event are available via the wepay link below. However, we encourage attendees to consider donating the ticket cost to support the scholarship.

Admission: Free in advance by Wednesday, July 18th, $5 at the door.
Free advance tickets: https://www.wepay.com/events/tappumproom
Let AACN know you're coming here: http://meetu.ps/3mPFG

Getting There: Gold Coast, Close to the Clark/Division Red Line and #22, 36, 70, 151, and 156 CTA buses, limited street parking and valet available

Questions? Leave a comment below.

About Our Sponsor
Merry Richards Jewelers offers a wonderful array of elegant designs using the finest diamonds and gemstones. They are known throughout Chicagoland for their philosophy of impeccable, personalized customer service. http://www.merryrichardsjewelers.com/

About Our Beneficiary
TAF is a 501(c)3 non-profit organization focused on developing personal leadership in youth and building strong cultural and social ties. TAF empowers youth to develop a strong sense of self, compassion and understanding of others, excellent interpersonal skills, and leadership abilities that will positively impact society in meaningful ways. For more info on the scholarships, see http://blog.tafworld.org/2012/06/taf-2012-tap-chicago-scholarship/

More about TAP-Chicago:
http://www.tapchicago.org/

More about KACC
http://www.kac-chicago.org/

More about NU-A5:
http://alumni.northwestern.edu/nu-a5
AACNers, don't forget to RSVP on our meetup page! Register early for free admission. Remember, dress in business/business casual attire and bring tons and tons of business cards!
Don't forget that AACN has a special discount code!

Join AACN and other Asian American organizations for a professional networking event. Remember to come dressed in your business-casual attire and bring plenty of business cards to hand out! 

RSVP at AACN's meetup page http://www.meetup.com/AsianAmericanChicagoNetwork/events/72159512/ so we know you're coming!

ACCNers, sign up for Kollaboration (July 7th) 7 PM to 9 PM so we can attend as a GROUP and also attend as the LARGEST organized group. Let's aim for at least 50 to 100 members from our group attending.

If you aren't sure what Kollaboration is... it's actually a nationwide competition held in large cities across America. It showcases some of the most talented individuals within the Asian American community.  Many of the famous 'youtubers' out there jumpstarted their careers with Kollaboration.  See the website below for this year's lineup.

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=aAwG4dLuXHk&feature=g-all-esi.

or http://kollaborationchicago.org/

1) PLEASE RSVP ON THE AACN MEETUP PAGE FIRST SO WE CAN HAVE HEADCOUNT OF AACNers.

http://kollaborationchicago2012.eventbrite.com/

(Only available for the top 3 members - evidence of purchased guest tickets must be shown to organizers) For questions.. please e-mail Jonathan via Meetup.com.

Hi Linda! Welcome to the Asian American Chicago Network (AACN)! Please visit our page on Meetup.com as well for a list of our upcoming events (http://www.meetup.com/AsianAmericanChicagoNetwork) :)
Sign up if you're interested and RSVP on our meetup.com page as well :) Let's get sporty!

The Asian American Chicago Network is focused on connecting younger and working Asian-Americans to NEW friends and connecting you to the city of Chicago! Our group targets those who are new professionals and working professionals.

Are you new to Chicago? Have you lived here your entire life? Do you want to meet others in a fun / friendly environment? We have activities that range from outdoor/sports, picnics, potlucks, brunch clubs, dinners, socials, and nightlife to just name a few! Organizers will always help facilitate fun networking and mingling.

Please join us to celebrate AACN's birthday, and also our members and sponsors who have supported us and made this organization possible. This will be a daytime event with TAP-Chicago, NUA5, Kollaboration, and other Asian American organizations in Chicago.

THE ANTHEM has generously offered to sponsor our one-year anniversary party by providing us with event space and special AACN wristbands for great discounted drink specials. 

There will be $3 whiskey, as well as $3 beer specials and $6 Effen Vodka shots. The Anthem also has great food!  

We are so excited to celebrate this special event with you. Please invite your friends to come as well! 

To RSVP, check out our Meetup page: http://meetu.ps/3mPFG

AACN Facebook Users, if you haven't signed up on our meetup page, please join our meetup page also where you can get connected with our community in an easy to use format including messaging / discussion boards.  For example, check out the AACN 1 Year Anniversary Screen shot from our Meetup Page.

AACN is one year old and we are excited to invite you and our 450 members to our party! The main event will take place on Saturday, September 8, from 1:00pm to 5:00pm. We're also inviting other Asian American organizations in Chicago to celebrate with us, so come out, eat food, have fun, and meet more people. After the main event, evening festivities will follow (because that's how AACNers roll). 

We will send out further details in a week or so, but please mark your calendars:
Saturday, September 8, 1:00pm-5:00pm. Yea!
happy birthday!!
That's how we roll!!

Join AACN for the Chicago Korean Festival at 7:00pm tomorrow (Saturday). We are going to try to meet near the main stage on the Kedzie and Bryn Mawr Blvd intersection. Our organizers, Frank Tha Tank (Flanky) and Tony Au will be around the Rick's Auto Body shop side. Be there and be square!

Also, if you didn't get a spot for brunch but still want to hang before the Korean festival, message us to find out where we are in the afternoon. We might be around North Avenue Beach for the Air and Water show.

Because of how quickly our 1 p.m. brunch filled up, we're hosting another one this Saturday, August 18th. One of our goals / aims is to meet new members and old members at smaller-scale events, so it's easier for people to talk and get to know each other. 

The second brunch of the day will be at Luxbar (18 E Bellevue Pl, Chicago, IL) at 10:30 a.m. Please arrive at least 5 minutes early and bring cash. 

We can also check out the Air and Water show afterwards if people want, since it's right next door. 

Please RSVP on our meetup page if you want to eat Brunch so we can get a better headcount. We have 5 spots left, so hurry!
great to hear that Shenyun! Hope to see you at Sushi Samba tonight!

We hope you had fun at the Ginza Festival this past Saturday. Come out again this Saturday to join AACN for the 17th Annual Chicago Korean Festival for more fun! 

This event will feature all things pop-Korean, from the food and sports, to music and b-boy/girls. 

To RSVP, please visit our meetup page, where we host our events: http://meetu.ps/3mPFG. 

To get the latest updates about the festival, check out their Twitter (@ChiKoreanFest ) and Facebook (ChiKoreanFestival) pages.

Also, KRCC (Korean-American Resource and Cultural Center) is looking for interested volunteers to help out for ONE shift with voter registration (Sat or Sunday 2-5 or 5-8 pm).  Contact me at Randy@chicagokrcc.org.  It's gonna be a great weekend of festivities.  ALSO, if you are NOT a registered voter, we can sign you up there.  It'll take 2 minutes of your time!!!
Yes! Thanks for the reminder, Randy Kim!

Please check our meetup page ( http://meetu.ps/3mPFG) for the meeting location for AACN's Korean Festival meetup on Saturday, August 18, 2012, at 7:00 PM. 

If you're interested in participating in some of the featured events such as SSIREUM, Korean Idol, K-Pop Dance-Off, Free Throw, or 3-Point Shootout. Register here ->http://www.chicagokoreanfestival.com/v2/application-forms/ 

After the festival, we can visit some of the cafes on the street for Pat-Bin-Soo (Korean shaved-ice) and lounges within the area for some post-festival activities!

See you Saturday night!

We've had many new members the past few months, and what better way to meet and get to know new folks --- over yummy food! If you haven't been to an event the last few months, please join us as well for this small event. 

We should have a definite location and time by Thursday so if you can make it, PLEASE RSVP on our meetup page (http://meetu.ps/3mPFG).  However, if you need to change your RSVP later, please do so by Friday so others may join.

This is also a good opportunity to get to know your organizer(s) in a smaller setting and suggest events, activities, or places for the group to explore.

Please bring cash so it will be easier to split checks later on. If not, we will use Chase Quick Pay.

See you on Saturday!

If you need something to break up your week and you're feeling a bit anti-social, come out to TAP-Chicago's happy hour at Sushi Sumba on Thursday! I heard that the venue is great and lots of people will be there, too. Details can be found on the TAP-Chicago Facebook page.
I feel so bad for our servers or bartenders... If one of us orders a drink they may end up serving that drink to some other person... true story happened at the last TAP event. lol

Four days left before one of the largest, authentic Japanese Festival in Chicago! We already have 33 AACNers joining us, so you should come, too! 

This festival has something for everyone, whether you're looking for food:

    The famous (Japanese) open pit
    Charcoal grilled chicken teriyaki dinner, udon ,sushi, edamame
    For dessert, kintoki (Japanese snow cone topped with sweet azuki beans)."

Perhaps performances:

    Ongoing Taiko Drummers
    Judo, Aikido, and Kendo Fencing Demo
    Bonsai, ikebana (flower arranging), kaminingyo (paper dolls), calligraphy, brush painting, silk flowers, and Japanese arts and crafts Demo

If you had a long week, stop on over to the temple for Buddhist worship and mediation.

Once the festivity is over, we'll try to head on over to Murasaki for a Japanese nightcap. *This is subject to change based on turnout*

Visit our meet up page for details about this event this weekend: http://meetu.ps/3mPFG!
Are you ready for this Saturday?! I hope so! Please check out meetup page as well for details about round 2!  http://meetu.ps/3mPFG

Hey guys, KRCC will be participating at the Korean Festival on the north side during the weekend of August 18-19th.  We are looking for adult volunteers to help register new voters.  It'll be a great way to meet our staff and the kids that we work with, as well as have fun at the event.  If you want more info, please send me a PM.  Thank you!

Randy Kim

Hello AACN! Join TAP for November's happy hour at Barcito! Enjoy yummy drinks and eats with your new and old TAP friends! https://www.facebook.com/events/539448459474162/

If you're looking to get inspired and motivated, here's an event for you: the Asian American Art of Leadership. This is best described like Asian American TED Talks where successful Asian Americans in different fields share their knowledge, stories, and advice on how they became successful.

Some of the Speakers are: 
Ashish Ranganekar, CEO and founder of Benchprep, Startup Luminary 
CIA Agent Micheal Mau 
Dj Flipside, Jumpsmokers, Official Chicago Bulls DJ 
David Namkung, Managing Partner, Clarity Partners 
Ameya Pawar, 47th ward Alderman, 1st Asian American Alderman 
Marissa Bucheit, 2012 Miss CHicago

There will also be booths with representatives from various companies to be onsite for job recruitment and an opportunity to receive advice from career counselors for resume and cover letter review and for mock interviews. As well as a networking reception with other Asian American professionals and executives.

Cost: $30 (Includes light breakfast and buffet lunch) 
$35 (after October 31st)

November 9 at Northpark University from 10am-3pm.

Space is LIMITED! Tickets are one a first come first serve basis. More info and registration 
https://aoldc.eventbrite.com/

Event is Sponsored by CIA, Chade Fashions, American Family Insurance, Pepsico and In Partnership with: National Association of Asian American Professionals, Filipino American Network, Korean American Coalition of Chicago, Kollaboration Chicago, Network of Indian Professionals, Taiwanese American Professionals.

Portion of the proceeds will go to benefit the Chade Foundation scholarship fund.

Event Location: In the warehouse on 1133 W. Fulton Market, Chicago.

As always, tickets will sell out, so get yours when you can!
If you procrastinated and haven't purchased your ticket, we just got a special $5 off promo code! Use promo code "aacn" and you'll get $5 off your ticket.

Come out and have a blast!!!!

I just wanted to send out a quick reminder about our lunch at Triple Crown this Saturday, October 26 at 12:00 p.m. Triple Crown has arranged a delicious pre-fixed menu for us and we'd love for you to join us for a casual lunch where you can connect with other AACNers. This is a smaller-size event for those who are more comfortable in smaller groups. Please RSVP or join the wait list! 

Place: Triple Crown Restaurant, 2217 South Wentworth Ave
Time: 12:00 pm
Cost: $20/per person

Menu: 
APPETIZERS
Lao Huo Soup 
Triple Crown Dim Sum Combo Platter

ENTREES
Sizzling Beef Tenderloin with Black Pepper 
Walnut Shrimp 
Spicy Stir Fried Spare Ribs 
Salt + Pepper Seafood Trio 
Crispy Skin Chicken (Whole) 
Steam Tilapia (Hong Sue or Sweet and Sour style available) 
Japanese Tofu with Vegetable 
Szechwan Style String Beans 
Chicken Hand Pull Noodle

DESSERT
Sesame Ball

Hey, hey, AACNers. 

We're hanging out at Untitled tonight starting at 9:30. Come join us! 

Address: 111 W Kinzie. This place is located right next to the CVS on Kinzie and LaSalle and before the parking Garage. 

CTA: Merchandise Mart (Brown, Purple)

Where we will Meet: Whiskey room to the left. 

Dress code: No gym shoes or tees. 

See you there!

Friday night!!! Sept 20. This Friday night. Join AACN at Untitled, Kinzie and Lasalle. 111 w kinzie, for drinks at 930pm. No cover. No gym shoes, tees.

e were here a few weeks ago and it was fun, so we're coming back. This time, there will be a burlesque show as well! 

Known as one of Chicago's newest hidden (hence the name "Untitled") / trendy whiskey, champagne, and full bar lounge, this place is actually decent.

Location: This place is located right next to the CVS on Kinzie and LaSalle and before the parking Garage. It's literally the door next to the CVS and there are no signs either except for probably a bouncer / and a roped off area. (There is easy parking at garages next door $12 to $15 the whole night.

CTA - Merchandise Mart stop is only 2 blocks away

NOTE: Parking on the streets around Hubbard is only until 11 PM. (Cars are towed from 11 PM to 5 AM on those streets) - Watch out for signs. TAKE PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION / CABS IF POSSIBLE.

The space—part restaurant, part lounge and part whiskey bars—boasts 17,000 square feet in an unmarked building with soaring ceilings, a street-level facade with a monthly rotating mysterious storefront, 120-seat restaurant and a whiskey lounge, aka The Library, with 18-foot ceilings, tufted leather walls, velvet booths, gilded framed mirrors that shield nearly 10 LCD TVs and a wall of wooden liquor lockers holding one of the country's largest collections of whiskey.

Note Dress CODE Enforced: Men, this place has a STRICT dress code at night. Wear dress shoes, no baggy jeans, no sneakers, and no polos accepted. You should be fine with jeans and a button down shirt. Get there on time for no lines - this place is free to enter... but if you come later.. you will be waiting in line. Ladies, use judgment - usually they dont reject ladies but just no Sneakers, t-shirts, etc

All: The bouncer usually asks are you here for dinner or drinks. Just respond drinks.

Where we will Meet: WHISKEY ROOM TO THE LEFT.  We will meet here first (don't worry, you can drink anything you want - such as Champagne in the other room or a full bar in the main room - we are just meeting here first). Once you enter and go down the stairs, go directly to the left room which is the whiskey room of the restaurant/lounge, a hostess usually asks you if they can help you or are you here for dinner / drinks? Say drinks and just walk towards the side room on the left. 

For late comers, we will probably eventually work our way to the back of the main dance floor (the bar in the back). 

Don't say you're here with AACN as we are not doing a reservation with the place.  They won't understand you.

Look for Asians in the back and ask, "Are you with AACN? ;)" AACN will keep an eye out for you as well.

Be on time at 9:30 PM!  it shouldn't be too crowded in the Whiskey room around that time.

Dear all, 
I'm looking for a female roommate to share a new 2 bed (1100 square feet) in a fancy building in the loop. The apt is new with nice view of the river, lake, city and a balcony. 
It's a new fancy 2-BR with large built-in closet, your own private bathroom, 
lots of storage space, washer/dryer in the unit, fridge, oven, garbage disposal, dishwasher, all new, huge kitchen, dining area, huge living room with new comfortable couch, wifi, cable TV(I'm thinking of getting Uverse of Netflix too), nice view of the river, the lake and the city ( John Hancock & Sears tower) and most importantly, a super awesome roommate who's no hassle, funny, and super laid-back. 
Electricity, wifi, heat, gas, AC, water, all included in the rent. 
The two bedrooms are actually about the same size. I prefer the one that faces north so you can get the one with more lights.

Hey Everybody, 

I’m a graduate student committee leader in the Integrated Marketing Communications (IMC) program at Medill, Northwestern. We’re hosting our 4th annual Marketing Conference on Wednesday, Nov. 20th from 5-9pm in downtown Chicago for 500 guests and it's open to all professionals. The best part of all, it’s FREE! Free admission, food, alcoholic and non-alcoholic beverages, live music, all-star panel discussions, and a great opportunity to make professional connections and friends. This evening is endorsed by our wonderful sponsors. 

What is in it for you?
- Keynote Address by Keith Reinhard, Chairman Emeritus, DDB Worldwide, AAF Hall of Fame, NYF Lifetime Achievement award recipient
- An All-Star Panel (speakers are executives from various functions and industries) moderated by Dan Fietsam, Chief Creative Officer of Energy BBDO (IMC Alum) discusses “Who Needs Creativity?” 
- Live music and Food
- Social Hour, starting at 5PM

When and where should you come?
Date: November 20th, 2013
Time: 5PM to 9PM
Venue: Northwestern University Chicago Campus, Thorne Auditorium, 375 East Chicago Avenue, Chicago, IL 60611

To RSVP: http://www.eventbrite.com/e/talentq-an-annual-marketing-exposition-tickets-8868260205?aff=eorg. You will need to check in for the event, so make sure to rsvp. Feel free to extend this invitation to your colleagues and friends. 

For more info, click http://talentq.medill.northwestern.edu/, or facebook message me. 

Hope to see you there!

If you're looking to get inspired and motivated, the Asian American Art of Leadership is taking place this Saturday, November 9, from 10:00 a.m.-3:00 p.m. at Northpark University. This is best described as the Asian American TED Talks where successful Asian Americans in different fields share their knowledge, stories, and advice on how they became successful. For more info and registration information, please visit https://aoldc.eventbrite.com/  A small sample of speakers is below.

If you're interested and available this Saturday, e-mail Shenny directly to get your name on the list for a complimentary ticket (shenyunlwu@gmail.com). The first five people to e-mail me will get free admission. Tickets are $35 dollars at the door otherwise. 

Some of the Speakers are:
Ashish Ranganekar, CEO and founder of Benchprep, Startup Luminary
CIA Agent Michael Mau
Dj Flipside, Jumpsmokers, Official Chicago Bulls DJ
David Namkung, Managing Partner, Clarity Partners
Ameya Pawar, 47th ward Alderman, 1st Asian American Alderman
Marissa Bucheit, 2012 Miss Chicago

There will also be booths on site with representatives from various companies for job recruitment. There will also be an opportunity to receive advice from career counselors for resume and cover letter review and for mock interviews, as well as a networking reception with other Asian American professionals and executives.

Space is LIMITED! Tickets are on a first-come-first-serve basis. More info and registration
https://aoldc.eventbrite.com/

The 6th Annual Lunar Ball, Chicago’s largest fundraiser for Asian American young professionals and friends, will be held on Saturday, February 22nd. This year, we expect a crowd of 500+ of Chicago’s most accomplished and involved young professionals to fill the Chicago Cultural Center’s Preston Bradley Hall for an evening of fun, food, and dancing. The event will include tastings from Chicago’s top restaurants, open bar, cultural performances, multiple DJs, raffle, and silent auction. 

Proceeds from the event benefit charities including the community beneficiary Project Vision, a nonprofit organization with a mission to provide the youth of Chicago's Chinatown and Bridgeport communities with tools for educational, personal and civic development. 

There’s no better time than the Year of the Horse to meet new friends and professional contacts. The event sells out every year, to purchase tickets, please visit: http://lunarball2014.eventbrite.com/ or LunarBall.org for more information.

Early Bird Registration ends tomorrow! Twenty-five terrific panelists and moderators are on the agenda for our leadership forum this Saturday. Register at bit.ly/definingsuccess with code "KACC" for a free drink ticket and registration discount.

Our speakers list includes:
* a Bravo TV Top Chef contestant
* the only Korean American elected official in all of Illinois
* a holistic health practitioner and business owner
* a U.S. magistrate judge
* a not-for-profit real estate development director
* the COO of a new proprietary trading and hedge fund
* a documentary film director

Together with others from law, government, business, the arts, and non-profits, we will explore the challenges, opportunities, and hard choices that Asian Americans and Korean Americans have had to face in order to succeed.

For a complete list of speakers & to register, please visit bit.ly/definingsuccess.

Please help us spread the word! Thank you. #KACC #CKA #KAAC #KABA #Coalition #Chicago #2014LeadershipForum #DefineSuccess #Success

AACN Movie Fanatics, 

A Cantonese film starring Daniel Wu and Nick Cheung called THAT DEMON WITHIN is being released today (April 18th) at the AMC River East 21. Come support the film with your friends so we can get more Chinese-language films in Chicago! This film will be in Cantonese with Chinese and English subtitles. 

The China Lion Entertainment (http://www.chinalionentertainment.com) releases Chinese-language films across the U.S. and Canada and would love to make Chicago a more regular stop for their films; of course, the only way for that to happen is through the support of local audiences. Let's help make this happen! 

AACN is given 4 free admission tickets. These can be used between Monday and Thursday. Please message me if you're interested in the ticket. Limited to 1 per person.

The film currently has an average rating of 6.7 (out of 10) on 豆瓣电影 (http://movie.douban.com/subject/20515977/), a Chinese movie review site. That means Chinese people who've watched it deemed it better than average!

Read Variety magazine's review of the film: http://variety.com/2014/film/reviews/berlin-film-review-that-demon-within-1201094474/

Hello,

My name is Jia Min Gao and I am a research assistant working with doctoral student Julia Tran and Professor Nicola Curtin in the Psychology Department at Clark University.

I am reaching out to you today to see if you would like to volunteer to participate in an online survey that examines Asian Americans’ socio-political beliefs and behaviors. If you are interesting in taking the survey, please click on the link below:
https://clarku.co1.qualtrics.com/SE/?SID=SV_72qP4T9MsxBOzZP

People who are eligible to participate are Asian Americans who are 18 and older, and who currently live in the United States for at least three years. Asian international students, visitors to the United States, or anyone who are not planning to live in the United States permanently are not eligible.
 
Each participant will be asked to answer some questions about themselves and give their opinions on some socio-political issues. Participation is entirely voluntary and you don’t have to be politically or socially active to participate. You may decline to answer any question that you do not wish to answer, and you are free to discontinue the study at any time without penalty.

Your responses to all questions will be kept fully confidential. 
 
Upon completion of the survey, you will have the option to provide your email address for entry in a raffle for a $25 gift certificate.
If you have any questions regards to the study, please reply to this email jigao@clarku.edu or contact Julia Tran as jutran@clarku.edu.

Lastly, it would be wonderful if you could forward this email to any individuals who might be interested in participating. Doing so is by no means necessary, but it would be enormously appreciated.
Thank you so much for your time!
 
Sincerely,
 
Jia Min Gao

Hi! I was wondering what were the names of the Asian Promoters in Chicago? Visiting in June/July

Chicago Cares Serve-A-Thon (Free registration wtih Promo Code SP14)

Summer has finally dawned on us and the 21st Annual Chicago Cares Serve-A-Thon is round the corner! The Chicago Cares Serve-A-Thon is the single largest day of community service in Chicago, when more than 5,000 volunteers come together to make the city stronger and more vibrant. It is a great way to meet new people, network with other Discover employees and give back to community! 

Use Promo Code SP14 when you register to avoid the $45 registration fee. This is being sponsored by Discover! 
If you tell me (Kelvin) your T-shirt size in the comments or to me directly, I can get you a free Discover Volunteers T-shirt in addition to the Chicago Cares volunteer shirt. 

Register at https://chicagocares.donordrive.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=register.start&eventID=500 
Instructions are below.

1.  On the event homepage, click “Register Now”. Select “Sponsor Volunteer”, input your individual fundraising goal (optional)  and choose the “Join a Team” option. 

2.  Under “Choose An Existing Team”, DISCOVER will be listed under the Sponsor Team section in the dropdown. The company name will be first, followed by the ECG name. SELECT, ‘Discover APAD’ . 

3.  Choose your company from the dropdown, input your birthday, and select your preferred lunch. 

4.  Input your contact information, preferred email address, and new password. 

5.  On the following page, next to the Registration Fee, click “Promo Code”. Type in your Sponsor Discount Promo Code SP14 and hit “Apply”. Remind your family and friends they will need to do the same. Otherwise, they will be prompted to enter your credit card information to pay the $45 registration. 

6.  Review your information. Click “Complete Registration” to submit.  

Transportation from Daily Plaza to the project site, likely a Chicago Public school, will be provided as well as lunch and post volunteer entertainment.

7:30 A.M. - 8:30 A.M. VOLUNTEER CHECK-IN AT DALEY PLAZA 

8:30 A.M. EVENT KICKS OFF, VOLUNTEERS BOARD BUSES FOR PROJECT SITES 

2:30 P.M. - 3:30 P.M. PROJECTS END AND VOLUNTEERS RETURN TO DALEY PLAZA 

3:30 P.M. - 5:30 P.M. POST-EVENT CELEBRATION WITH MUSIC, FOOD, AND DRINK

Hi everyone, 

My name is Christine and I am a 4th year Ph.D. student in Counseling Psychology Program at Loyola University Chicago. I wonder if you could help participate in the survey of my dissertation. It aims to examine the immigration-related meaning-making process. It will take about 15 minutes to complete and, as a token of my appreciation, you will be able to enter a raffle to win 1 of 20 $20 gift cards.
 
If you (1) are an adult Chinese/Taiwanese immigrant who lived in the home country (e.g., China, Hong Kong, Taiwan, Malaysia, Singapore, Vietnam, Philippine, etc) until 18 years old and then moved to the U.S., and (2) have became a US citizen, in the process of becoming a U.S. citizen, or have a clear intention to reside the U.S. on a long term basis, please consider filling this survey!
 
The English version and the Chinese version are identical. Just pick one of the links and your help is greatly appreciated!
 
English-
http://snapsurveys.luc.edu/snapwebhost/surveylogin.asp?k=139900349053   
 
Chinese-
http://snapsurveys.luc.edu/snapwebhost/surveylogin.asp?k=139900351537 
 
Thank you very much for reading this note. Please feel free to let me know if you have any comment or question. 

Sincerely,
Christine Chih-Ting Chang, M.Ed.
Counseling Psychology, 
Loyola University Chicago
cchang4@luc.edu

In commemoration of Asian American Pacific Heritage Month purchase a copy of the documentary film "Valor With Honor". A film that can watched with your family gatherings or just by yourself on your computer.

"Valor with Honor" not only records the deeds and emotions of the veterans of the 442nd, but highlights the difficult struggle of the brave Nisei both on and off the battlefield. It is a suburb documentary." Professor Joe Roth, San Jose State University

"Valor with Honor" preserves vivid first hand accounts of fierce battles, dramatic rescues, and the liberation of Jewish prisoners at Dachau" Esther Newman, Discover Nikkei

"Valor with Honor" is an independent documentary film based on over 35 oral histories on Japanese American WW2 vets that served in 442nd Regimental Combat Team. The film is 85 minutes long and in a standard dvd format. Visit www.valorwithhonor.com
for information and news on upcoming screenings and news about this powerful documentary film.

Dvds available at www.valorwithhonor.com, Kinokuniya Bookstores, Nikkei Traditions, and e Bay.

The Asian American Business Association (AABA) is a business-development and community-outreach organization aimed to promote entrepreneurship, leadership and job creation for Asian Americans and immigrants.

One of their signature programs is the Asian American Business Expo, a one-day event with more than 20 workshops and 60 exhibits. The Expo is FREE of charge and open to everyone. Attendance in 2013 exceeded 1,000, a large increase from the previous year’s 800. 

This year, it'll take place on Saturday, September 6 from 9 AM to 3 PM
at the UIC Forum, 725 W Roosevelt Road, Chicago, IL 60607.

Network and Socialize @AKIRA's 10th Annual Fashion Show 
Date: Sunday, September 23
Time: 5:00pm
Place: Grossinger City Autoplex, 1500 N. Dayton St., Chicago, IL 

AACN was able to meet John Cotay, the owner of Akira, last week at our Untitled event. AACN will help push Akira's fashion show this year as he shares the same vision of bringing together the community for great events such as the Akira Fashion show, which has thousands of attendees. 

Come join AACN at AKIRA's Fashion Show, one of AACN's larger events this year.  If you have never been to an AKIRA Fashion Show, you don't want to miss out. Many local celebrities and models attend. This is NOT an ordinary "Fashion Show". (Think of it as a big party - Dress to Impress).

Schedule: 
Doors open at 4 PM 
Show begins at 7 PM 
Afterparty @ Japonais begins at 9 PM
Proceeds will benefit 5 local charities: Imerman Angels, the Human Rights Campaign, Project Ladybug, Clara’s House, & AKIRA’s Fashion Scholarship Fund   Must be 16+ to attend / Valid ID required for entry    

For more details check out our website: http://www.asianamericanchicagonetwork.org 
and meetup page: http://meetu.ps/3mPFG. 

Also check out AKIRA's official fashion show page: http://www.shopakira.com/akiras-metropolitain-fall-fashion-show

and their Facebook page: https://www.facebook.com/akirachicago

TAP-Chicago would like to invite the members of AACN to our monthly TAPpy Hour tomorrow. This TAPpy Hour is extra special not only because Chris Chang all the way from TAP-SF is attending, but it’s also the birthday of our Director of Membership Services, Howard Wei!

Also, two of TAP-Chicago's aspiring photographers will be offering professional headshots for our attendees. Are you still using the same old profile picture to represent your professional identity on LinkedIn or other professional websites? AACN will be at Untitled and Nara tonight! Check our meetup page for details. http://meetu.ps/3mPFG

For those of you who aren't doing anything Friday evening, check out Nara if you like Korean Food / Soju or come out to Untitled to meet other AACN members if you want to check out one of Chicago's trendiest bars / lounges.

Yes, this is part II for Untitled and no, we aren't running out of places that can fit our group; however, since we had such a great time last at Untitled, Come drink and network again this weekend.

Known as one of Chicago's newest hidden (hence the name "Untitled") / trendy bars and lounge, this place is actually decent.

Location: This place is located right next to the CVS and before the parking Garage. It's literally the door next to the CVS and there are no signs either except for probably a bouncer / and a roped off area. (There is easy parking at a garage about a block away -  (La Salle and Kinzie / Wells) $8 to $12 the whole night.

CTA - Merchandise Mart stop is only 2 blocks away

NOTE: Parking on the streets around Hubbard is only until 11 PM. (Cars are towed from 11 PM to 5 AM on those streets) - Watch out for signs.

The space—part restaurant, part lounge and part whiskey bars—boasts 17,000 square feet in an unmarked building with soaring ceilings, a street-level facade with a monthly rotating mysterious storefront, 120-seat restaurant and a whiskey lounge, aka The Library, with 18-foot ceilings, tufted leather walls, velvet booths, gilded framed mirrors that shield nearly 10 LCD TVs and a wall of wooden liquor lockers holding one of the country's largest collections of whiskey.

Note Dress CODE Enforced: Men, this place has a STRICT dress code at night. Wear dress shoes, no baggy jeans, no sneakers, and no polos accepted. You should be fine with jeans and a button down shirt. Get there on time for no lines - this place is free to enter... but if you come later.. you will be waiting in line. 

For more details and to rsvp, please check out our meetup page! http://meetu.ps/3mPFG

Please join AACN, TAP-Chicago, and the Asian Professional Network for a cool seminar by one of the top executives in the Asian American community. Unmi Song is a UChicago grad, worked in the finance industry, is on the board of several nonprofits, and was appointed by appointed by President Obama to serve on the President’s Advisory Commission on Asian Americans and Pacific Islanders. Come hear her speak on September 13, 6-7 pm, at the Morgan Stanley building. RSVP by September 12, 2pm.

Peace AACN folx!

I'm helping with social media and outreach for the Asian Pacific Islander American (APIA) Spoken Word & Poetry Summit 2015 in Chicago! :) This year our theme is: Now What?

And one of our online initiatives entails featuring different artists each week (or even multiple times a week) to highlight the variety in content, culture, context, etc. that already exists, but also raising the question of what is missing and how we can lift up those stories and ideas. 

If you have any questions or suggestion, would like to be featured, or would like to recommend artists to feature, or if you simply want to learn more and support our summit, please contact me at soultreecambanationofthangs@gmail.com

Peace,
s

"442nd" is the current working title for an independent feature dramatic film on the WW2 Japanese American 442nd Regimental Combat Team. The 442nd was unit of brigade strength that became the most decorated unit for its size and length of the service in the history of the US Armed forces.
The goal is to finish a spec trailer and start an online funding campaign. Once a solid budget is secured then production will start shooting in the SF Bay Area and Northern California locations.
Invite your friends and family members to support this new film project about the heroes who served in the 442nd.
The film follows a documentary film also about the 442nd called Valor With Honor. Valor has been slowly screening at specific locations across the US. www.valorwithhonor.com

Spec trailer "442nd":
http://youtu.be/L0bZcJ7C3J4

Visit and join the Facebook group page:
https://www.facebook.com/groups/371765589589920/

"Go For Broke" tee shirts are available in small, medium, large, XL and XXL. Each shirt is 20$ each (plus CA sales tax for CA residents only) and shipping.
Send email orders and Paypals to torasanfilms@yahoo.com
Funds raised by tee shirt sales will help support production of "442nd" a dramatic independent film on the famous WW2 US Army regiment. Mahalo for all your

Hi AACN people. My team is hiring a junior/entry level role in decision strategy, specifically for data supply management. You would be primariy working on vendor management with the possiblity of broader responsibilities based on your skill set. 

Please apply at http://mydiscovercareer.com/ using the job posting #P132984. In addition, feel free to use me as an internal referral when applying and/or mail your resume to KelvinLeung@Discover.com after you've applied on the website. The posting details are copied below:

Job Description: Vendor Compliance, Job ID # P132984

Discover Financial Services (DFS) has an opportunity on the Information Management team with the Customer Service & Credit Management department to assist the team in performing critical vendor management.
Specific responsibilities include:
•Support Information Management team with maintaining the Vendor Risk and Monitoring programs.
•Inspect documents, records, disclosures, systems and reports to verify compliance with DFS’ Vendor Management policies.
•Compile and maintain necessary documentation (contracts, insurance certificates, audit report and etc) from DFS’ third party vendors in an easily accessible database.
•Facilitate Vendor on-boarding due diligence process
•Collaborate with internal business partners to ensure that contracting, security reviews, and relevant projects are performed in a timely and complete manner.
•Promote compliance awareness within the business area and support a culture of compliance.

Skills

Skills
• Bachelor’s Degree in a relevant field preferred
•1-3 years’ experience in financial services, insurance or lending industry
•Demonstrated experience with using Microsoft Office software (Word, Excel, PowerPoint and Access).
•Must have excellent oral and written communication skills
•Self-motivated and ability to work independently.

Educational Requirements

Bachelors Degree

The UIC Asian American Studies Program Community Engagement Project (ASAM CEP), an AANAPISI initiative, is collaborating with CIRCA-Pintig (http://www.circapintig.com/) to plan a theatrical performance, Reclaiming Life: Silencing Stigma, with featuring stories of Asian American mental health and disability issues, on April 16th at 4:00 p.m. to 6:00 p.m. at the James Stukel Tower Event Center (718 W. Rochford St.).

More information about last year's performance, Silencing Stigma: Speaking Out, can be found here: http://news.uic.edu/overpowering-silence-on-cultural-stigmas

We are seeking Asian American actors to tell 5 stories, which include:

2 Korean females, with approximate age in late 20s to early 30s
1 Vietnamese female, who identifies as bisexual, with approx. age in late 20s to early 30s 
1 Iraqi female, with approx. age in late 30s to early 40s
1 Filipino female, with approx. age in late teens and early 20s

As of now, rehearsals are scheduled for April 9-10 and 13-15 from 6:00 p.m. to 10:00 p.m..

If you are interested in participating in this production, please contact Professor Rooshey Hasnain of ASAM (roosheyh@uic.edu) and Ginger Leopoldo, Board President of CIRCA-Pintig (ginger@circapintig.com) by Thursday, March 9th by 5:00 p.m.

We look forward to hearing from you.

Thank you!

The UIC AANAPISI Initiative is fully funded by the U.S. Department of Education. UIC is federally recognized as a Minority Serving Institution (MSI) through its status as a funded Asian American and Native American Pacific Islander Serving Institution.

Hi Guys,

Looking to fill 2 more open positions in my department at Discover. One entry level, one entry/experienced depending on the person. These haven't been posted on the careers site yet, so please send resumes directly to KelvinLeung@Discover.com for review if interested.

Entry level: Credit Bureau dispute resolution. Need an associate level candidate that will work with credit bureaus to monitor and identify any data quality issues with consumer information. Needs familiarity working with data sets in SAS and SQL based tools as well as project management skills. Financial or engineering backgrounds a plus.

Entry/Experienced hire: Level will depend on your experience. Need a candidate for the new initiatives team within risk management that will investigate new products and companies that provide analytic tools and data for Discover's risk management department. This position will work with various analytics and modeling teams within risk management and with external companies ranging from start ups to established corporations. After investigating, you will design and facilitate proof of concept and pilot tests as well as review evaluations with senior management. If the product passes, you will help negotiate pricing, contract service level, and structure implementation plans. Experience or education in the fundamentals of statistical model building is necessary as is experimental design. Project management skills required. Corporate negotiation experience is a plus. Knowledge of SAS and/or SQL language required, although actual data work is minimal.
No SQL experience sadly.

About MATTER 

MATTER is a community of healthcare entrepreneurs, innovators and industry leaders working together in a shared space to individually and collectively fuel the future of healthcare technology. MATTER’s mission is to proactively connect and promote collaboration between entrepreneurs, scientists, physicians, investors and industry partners in order to bring next-generation products and services to market that improve quality of care and save lives. 

MATTER, a not-for-profit organization, was developed by a team of entrepreneurs and industry leaders with the support of the state of Illinois. MATTER began as a project of ChicagoNEXT, Mayor Rahm Emanuel’s council on technology and innovation, which is part of World Business Chicago. For more information, visit matterchicago.com and follow @matterchicago.

We are hiring.  Office is located in Burr Ridge, IL.  Pm me if you're interested...

BA/QA Analyst

The BA role consists is responsible for making sure that the IPpay SAAS application meets the needs of its customers. The Software Business Analyst works directly with clients to gather requirements, and acts as the technical liaison between the software development teams and clients in an agile environment. The Business Analyst works closely with Product owners on complex projects in assisting with project direction and requirements gathering. The Business Analyst will also work closely with the development team to clarify acceptance criteria, test functionality, and accept completed user stories.

The QA role consists is responsible for making sure that the IPpay SAAS application meets the acceptable quality bar.  Responsibilities include testing software by using it (like you do when you visit a website and click around), and writing programs to automate various tasks or tests for the system.  Candidates who have been successful in this role generally have some experience running a production website and database.  QA is responsible for coming up with test plans and test cases (imagine a big list of everything you would need to test to make sure something worked), as well as executing these plans.

The perfect BA candidate should be rigorous and thorough, have a great passion for communications and an understanding of how software code works in a SaaS environment.  Strong attention to details is important and this role tends to involve a lot of communication with engineers, designers, product people and customers to verify functionality, so they should also be a good team player with strong written and verbal skills.

The perfect QA candidate should know how to break things, be rigorous and thorough, have a great passion for debugging and troubleshooting systems and an understanding of how software code works in a SaaS environment.  Strong attention to details is important and this role tends to involve a lot of communication with engineers, designers, product people and customers to verify functionality, so they should also be a good team player with strong written and verbal skills.

DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES

• Understanding security and PCI-DSS v3.0 best practices
• Adhering to a PCI-DSS approved SDLC for the testing of deployed bug fixes, improvements and features
• Interfacing with tier 1 customer support, select customers and third-party software partners to troubleshoot, understand and improve the application
• Interfacing with the appropriate development resources to understand implemented features / bug-fixes
• Validating new software functionality to ensure that security controls are effective
• Assist IPpay Product Owners by conducting business and technical analysis sessions to support new development efforts to meet current and projected business needs
• Provide expertise on the systems capabilities/limitations as it relates to business goals
• Prepare use cases and formal requirements documentation
• Drive the implementation of technology and process solutions from concept to completion
• Provide analysis and support for the project management, application development, and QA throughout the software development lifecycle
• Assist/Author in the development of test plans
• Assist/Author in the development of training and/or technical documentation
• Communicate needed changes to development teams
• Building functional and regression test cases against the features/enhancements/bug fixes specified by the Architect.  
• Validating new software functionality to ensure that security controls are effective
• Running Architect approved functional tests on software that has been unit tested by a Developer and placed into the TEST environment by AppAdmin.
• Reporting functional or security problems to the Developer, AppAdmin or Architect for necessary action
• Running Architect approved functional tests on software that has been deployed into the PROD environment by the respective AppAdmin and SysAdmin.
• Assists in enforcement of project deadlines and schedules
• Ensure all client deliverables meet software quality objectives
• Document application test plans based on software requirements and technical specifications.
• Summarize and communicate the test strategies
• Participate in User Acceptance Testing with the client stakeholders and SME's

QUALIFICATIONS

• Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering or related field
• Knowledge of Software Development Life Cycle
• Knowledge of SQL Server, IIS, . C# and associated .NET messaging technologies
• Experience in the development of detailed documentation of business requirements, business process modeling and business use cases in both technical and non-technical languages
• Experience with requirements reviews with developers and other stakeholders such as product owners
• Experience with software testing preferred (Functional, Integration, Regression, User Acceptance, and Release Management)
• Knowledge of PCI 3.0 compliant development practices and how they pertain to Quality Assurance needs
• Excellent written and verbal communication skills, with ability to communicate effectively with clients
• Ability to manage multiple projects at one time, often with changing requirements as team needs may dictate
• Passion for learning new things
• Comfortable and adaptable in a fast-paced environment
• Strong analytical and problem solving / troubleshooting skills
• Project management skills

To the Korean-American voters living in the 8th through 10th district (North/Northwest suburbs) to come out and do Early Voting this Saturday at Glenview Village Hall; 1225 North Waukegan Road, Glenview IL from 9 am to 5pm.  Read my article in the Glenview Press for more information.  Don't forget to vote.  The 8th (Duckworth vs. Walsh) and 10th (Dold vs. Schneider) are hotly contested and will make a difference in the US House.  Let the Asian American voice be heard!!!!  This is an opportunity to show that the Asian-American voice will be an important factor in today's politics.

Casting Call for MFA Thesis Film, “ Blind in Chinatown”
Director: Juelle Daley
Producers: Truman Liu
Director of Photography: Darius Dawson
Shoot Dates:Early December 2015. City: Chicago
Renumeration: Unpaid however we are willing to pay for your travel expenses /accommodations in Chicago ; food ; film credit as well as a copy of film for the actor’s professional reel.
SYNOPSIS: Javon, now on parole is driven to shift his energy toward achieving his dream of returning to Culinary School. Assigned to complete his mandatory service hours at a restaurant in Chinatown, his unlikely friendship there with Yiping, a bright-eyed Chinese female immigrant will test the bounds of loyalty, honesty and beauty.
CASTING:
Female Chinese lead, YIPING, age 20-25 years old, to play a recent Chinese immigrant from a rural background now in Chicago. Must be able to speak Mandarin fluently and willing travel to Chicago for the shoot.
Male Supporting Chinese Actor, KANG RAN, 25-30 years old, hipster who is super savy and well assimilated to American culture. He has the ability to maneuver easily between the American and Chinese cultural universe. Must be able to speak Mandarin fluently and willing travel to Chicago for the shoot.
Male lead, JAVON, African-American, 20-30 yr old, athletic, streetwise, stoic, ambitious, guarded and whose tender side is carefully concealed.
Supporting Actor, Any ethnicity PAROLE OFFICER, 35-50 yr old, always suspicious, unforgiving and prone to loosing his temper and patience.
If you're interested, please email me your headshot and resume to trumanliu@icloud.com and I will email you the audition address.PS 依萍美玲和康然的角色最好会讲中文～ 更多信息，可以Facebook我

Open position in Chicago 

Operations Assistant Job Description  
Award winning Architectural Firm seeks service and detail oriented professional to join their team.
KRUECK + SEXTON ARCHITECTS is an internationally recognized architecture practice dedicated to creating designs that are new, useful, understandable, and visually and functionally enduring over time.
Mission
Krueck + Sexton Architects is passionately dedicated to realizing architecture that embraces creativity and innovation.  We believe in the power of imagination, the delights of discovery and the ability of architecture to inspire and improve life.  
Job Description:
Krueck + Sexton is currently seeking a full-time Operations Assistant to join our team. This person will be an integral part of our client experience as well as responsible for providing financial and clerical services. This includes assisting with daily tasks, processing and monitoring payments and expenditures, along with greeting and meeting clients, setting up meeting rooms and assisting where needed.  This person is truly the face of our Company.  Position reports to the company Office Director and will work collaboratively with all staff including, architects and principals
Responsibilities:  
• Greet and welcome clients, guest and other professionals
• Answer the general office phone calls
• Ensure all client meetings are set up
• Reconcile monthly credit card statements
• Enter invoices for payments
• Prepare and process accounts payable checks
• Prepare bank deposits
• Assist in processing employee expense reimbursements
• Assist with Social Media needs
• Assist with marketing proposals
• Make necessary domestic travel arrangements
• All around willingness to be a team member and support in other ways not noted
Requirements:  
• Minimum of 2 years related work experience
• Strong communication skills, strong initiative, ability to work independently and within a team environment
• Must have excellent organizational skills and have a strong attention to detail
• Ability to work in a fast paced, growing environment and be willing to pitch in where needed
• Must have excellent organizational skills and have a strong attention to detail
• Must be familiar with Microsoft Office programs such as MS-Excel and MS-Word
• Prefer experience with Adobe InDesign, Photoshop and Illustrator
• Experience with computerized accounting systems a plus
• Strong personal ability to balance numerous tasks simultaeneously
• Bachelors degree preferred
• Art History experience welcome
To Apply: Please email resume and cover letter to Careers@ksarch.com
 
Note:  The statements herein are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by employees, and are not to be construed as an exhaustive list of responsibilities, duties, and skills required of personnel so classified.
Equal Opportunity Employer  
 
10.2.2015

RSVP:

TEA 
by Velina Hasu Houston
Directed by Helen Young 

Five Japanese “war brides” of American soldiers who live in Kansas, struggle with their cultural identity and the anti-Japanese prejudice that followed World War II. After one of the women commits suicide, her ghostly presence forces the other women to deal with the tensions of being Japanese in post-war America, marrying a ‘foreigner’ and living separated from their culture.

Featuring: Kaori Aosima, Francesca Atian, Ginger Leopoldo, Jin You, Karissa J. Murrell Myers. Understudies: Theresa Ro, Pearl Paramadilok.

Performances: 
Sundays @3pm
Monday 11/16 & 11/30 @7:30pm 
Thursday- Saturdays @7:30pm

Hey all! If you like Improv and Stand-up Comedy AND looking for something to start your Friday night, then you should go see Stir Friday Night! They are an all asian-american improv group and will be performing at The Revival!

Stir Friday Night (SFN) has been a fixture in Chicago’s comedy scene since 1995. Alumni include Danny Pudi (NBC’s Community), Steven Yeun (AMC’s The Walking Dead), Mary Sohn (Second City Mainstage), Christine Lin (Broadway’s “Chinglish”), and Rasika Mathur (MTV’s Wild ‘N Out). Comprised entirely of Asian-American actors, writers, comedians and improvisers, Stir Friday Night is a sketch, improv and stand up comedy party unlike anything you’ve seen before.

These guys are super amazing and talented and you can find tickets here: 
https://web.ovationtix.com/trs/pe.c/10053908 =D

Join us for our info session to learn how you, too, can host events for AACN! AACN is a member-run organization and we want to make sure we are doing what you want to do. Hi Everyone,

I'm the Civic Engagement Leader for Asian Americans Advancing Justice. I invite you all to help members in the Asian Community to GET OUT THE VOTE!!!

Students who speak Chinese (Mandarin or Cantonese), Taiwanese, Japanese, Korean, Bengali, Hindi, Gujarati, Urdu, Tagalog, and Arabic would be especially helpful but not required. We invite anyone to volunteer with us who is willing to make phone calls, speaks aforementioned languages, or invested in civic engagement.
 
Phone-banking Days:  
Week 1: February 22nd-February 27th
Week 2: February 29th-March 5th
Week 3: March 7th-March 14th
Mondays-Thursdays: 5:30-8:30PM; Saturdays: 11AM-2PM 
***Election Day: March 15th*** 

To sign up to phonebank or poll monitor, click on this link: https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1Q4MkWJxwv9kS2a0DdOF0V-4LkcyfemyhNU_xlK-L4Rc/edit#gid=0

https://lunarball2016launchparty.eventbrite.com/

Lunar Ball is coming soon! Join TAP for a Launch Party on Thursday, February 11th as their planning team, community partners, and beneficiaries celebrate the progress made and look forward to the big event on March 12th! 

Attendees will get a sneak peak into Lunar Ball 2016 highlights and have the opportunity to network with community partner members including Asian American Chicago Network (AACN), Asian Americans Advancing Justice-Chicago, Inter Apalsa, A-Squared Theatre Workshop, CFAA, Chinese Mutual Aid Association, HallyuCon Chicago, Hanul Family Alliance 한울종합복지관, Harvard Club of Chicago, Korean American Coalition of Chicago, Kollaboration Chicago, Northwestern University Asian and Asian American Alumni (NU-A5), Project: VISION, Social Quarters, TJCCC- Taiwanese Junior Chamber of Commerce Chicago, and University of Illinois Asian American Alumni Network!

Trophy Room is one of Chicagolands premier sports bar and is located in the heart of River North! In addition to drink specials and great networking, Launch Party attendees have the chance to win a Lunar Ball VIP ticket and buy tickets at a special price. 

Register on Eventbrite by Tuesday, February 9th for free entry, $5 afterward and at the door. 

https://lunarball2016launchparty.eventbrite.com/

Questions? Contact
Ethan Hou - Ethan@TapChicago.org
Fabio Hsu - fabio@lunarball.org

Getting There 
Limited street parking, CTA Chicago Brown/Purple Line or Grand Red Line Stop, many buses.

More about Lunar Ball:
Website: http://lunarball.org/
Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/LunarBallChicago

I'm inviting you all to the Asian American Leadership Forum #AALF2016! 

There will be a panel discussion led by women leaders talking about social justice issues / personal stories that calls us to action. We're excited to announce that TAZ AHMED of the Good Muslim, Bad Muslim podcast will be leading our plenary discussion, joined by local Asian American 'Changemakers' building within and beyond the community. 

The Professional Development Leadership track is for professionals in the business world discussing what it means to be an Asian American climbing the corporate ladder. The Grassroots fundraising track is for building an individual donor base to invest in your organizations. 

Make sure to register! TODAY: http://www.advancingjustice-chicago.org/what-we-do/leadership-development/asian-american-leadership-forum/

Are you new to Chicago? Have you lived here your entire life? Do you want to meet others in a fun / friendly environment? We have activities that range from outdoor sports, picnics, potlucks, brunch clubs, dinners, socials, and nightlife, to just name a few! Organizers will always help facilitate networking and mingling.

AACN is your vehicle to meet others, learn about what Chicago has to offer, and ultimately have the best networking experience. Our group targets those who are new professionals and working professionals.  

All of our events are hosted through Meetup, please check it out for the most updated event listings: http://www.meetup.com/AsianAmericanChicagoNetwork/

AACN is getting dim sum at Cai (2100 S. Archer) this Saturday at 11:30 a.m. Come join us for good food and fun conversations with new and old members!

[两颗红豆] We're hiring: 
 Iphone/Android/RoR Developer 
 We are looking for someone who can help us design and develop creative social applications that can promote user engagement on our site. Our current applications are developed on Ruby on Rails, Node.js, and HTML5. 

 Roles and Responsibilities: 
• Develop and test new iPhone and Android apps and HTML5 web app
• Integrate the apps with back end platforms, databases 
• Learn any new technologies, standards needed to perform the job 

 Requirements:
• Passionate about promoting social relationships and making an impact to our local communities.
• Must be able to install, setup and configure the development tools/environment independently
• Must be able to work independently on design, coding , debugging troubleshooting and deployment and any other programming related issues 
• Highly Passionate about mobile apps development 
• Experience with relational databases such as MS SQL Server 
• Has designed and built successful, viral applications on Facebook or other social media from scratch.
• Expert in at least one of the object-oriented programming languages (Ruby, PHP, Python, C++, Java, etc.).
• Has built an iphone app or android app.
• Bachelor or graduate degree in Computer Science from a top university, or equivalent.

After 3 months’ probationary period, if satisfied, we'll hire you as a permanent employee and offer H1B visa.
 Interested parties may contact jobs@2redbeans.com. Please include your resume and references to any past work that demonstrates your accomplishments whenever possible.
Edward Xiaosheng Zhang

AACN,

It's hard to believe how fast the summer has flown by.  In less than 1 WEEK, it will be AACN's 2 year anniversary of our group (We were founded summer 2011).  Note that on THIS SATURDAY @ 1:30 PM (08/24/13) at "The Kerryman" in the fun River North neighborhood, we will celebrate over 1,000 members ! (Includes Facebook members, AACN Meetup Members, and our www.asianamericanchicagonetwork.com members).

We need your FULL participation from you. This will be an AWESOME time of fun networking/socializing with drink specials and food specials you can purchase. (Think of it as the Best Day Time Happy Hour in Chicago on a Saturday). WE WILL HAVE A REGISTRATION/SIGN IN SHEET AREA, so even if this is your first event with AACN, THAT IS OK - just come (even if it’s by yourself, and we will introduce you to many fun people). PLEASE RSVP ON THE MEETUP PAGE so we can at least estimate how many will be there.

Additionally, we will be celebrating our 2 year party by recognizing Shenny. Shenny has been an organizer of AACN and has built many strong relationships with our members. She will be moving to Madison, WI with her husband in August. If you haven't met her before, be sure you say hi to her at the event! 

**********Important Announcement ************

 

Please join us to celebrate AACN's 2 Year Anniversary, and also our members and sponsors who have supported us and made this organization possible. 

Where: 

"The Keryman" (River North) 

661 N Clark Street, Chicago 

1:30 PM

We will be upstairs. PLEASE REMEMBER TO TIP THE BARTENDERS! (See Food Specials below)

AACN DRINK AND FOOD SPECIALS - 

Bar specials include 

$4 miller lite pints; 

$4 vodka; 

$5 o bombs. 

$7 Chicken Fingers, $8 Wings & $8 Black Angus Sliders

Transportation (EASY): Take the Red Line (Grand or Chicago Stop), walk west to clark and then head up north on clark if you get off Grand, or head South if you get off at Chicago and you are there.  

Parking - Metered. (It's suggested that you take PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION OR CABS) so you don't worry about your car.  Or Park in a lot. 

THE KERRYMAN has generously offered to sponsor our two-year anniversary party by providing us with an event space and special AACN drink specials. (Located in the River North neighborhood with great shopping, bars, and nightlife nearby)

We are so excited to celebrate this special event with you. Please invite your friends to come as well!

ANY QUESTIONS? CONTACT ANY ORGANIZER.

AACN, we have been invited to see the hippest, hottest, newest Asian movie which will come out soon - THE GRANDMASTER starring Tony Leung, Zhang Ziyi and Chen Chang (FOR FREE!!) on THIS WEDNESDAY August 14 at 7:00 p.m. at Kerasotes ICON Theatre in Chicago (Roosevelt St - 1011 South Delano Court East). This theater has free parking and is one of Chicago’s newest. You must print out the free passes from the following website.
 Log on to www.gofobo.com/rsvp and enter RSVP code: AACNTSVX

 Come and invite all your friends and family.

For event passes, log on to www.gofobo.com/rsvp and enter RSVP code: AACNTSVX

Close to west loop, also. AACN can hang out afterward.

___________________________________________
 
Synopsis:
THE GRANDMASTER is the highly-anticipated new film by acclaimed director Wong Kar Wai. Six years in the planning and three years in the making, THE GRANDMASTER is an epic action feature inspired by the life and times of the legendary kung fu master, Ip Man. The story spans the tumultuous Republican era that followed the fall of China’s last dynasty, a time of chaos, division and war that was also the golden age of Chinese martial arts. Filmed in a range of stunning locations that include the snow-swept landscapes of Northeast China and the subtropical South, THE GRANDMASTER features virtuoso performances by some of the greatest stars of contemporary cinema.

 With THE GRANDMASTER, Wong Kar Wai has made a kung fu film like no other. Years of research before production and a virtual battalion of martial arts trainers on set ensured that THE GRANDMASTER portrays both the Chinese martial arts and the world of the martial artists with unprecedented authenticity, with fight scenes choreographed by renowned action choreographer Yuen Wo Ping (THE MATRIX, KILL BILL, CROUCHING TIGER, HIDDEN DRAGON.) The trio of international superstars at the film’s heart – Tony Leung, Ziyi Zhang and Chang Chen – all underwent several years of rigorous and extremely challenging kung fu training for their roles.

Shot by French Director of Photography Philippe Le Sourd and with art direction by Wong’s long-term collaborators William Chang Suk Ping and Alfred Yau Wai Ming, THE GRANDMASTER represents a new chapter in the martial arts genre and in Wong Kar Wai’s own stellar career.

AACN FRIDAY EVENT! Come meet new friends and old friends alike at Vora! Vora is the newest Taiwanese Bar / restaurant to hit the Gold Coast of Chicago - with a full service bar / drinks / great environment. [Right next to Dave and Buster's] 

Rated with over 4 stars on yelp, we will check out this place, enjoy drinks, and possibly go out afterwards to enjoy the night.  
This place is known for its authentic Taiwanese dim sum, beef noodle soups, noodles, hot pot, etc. Additionally they have a pretty nice/chill bar. 

Check out the Yelp reviews here --> http://www.yelp.com/biz/vora-chicago Cost?: Depends on what you order, but please bring cash to make splitting the bill easier!  
Transportation: Easiest way is the Red Line (Clark/division (Red Line) 2 blocks south of the station on Clark. 

Street Parking is all around but until MIDNIGHT now. $4/hour. 

Questions? Please contact Shenny or Jonathan Chu
Vora is actually the ONLY Taiwanese lounge / restaurant in the downtown area.
